Package org.cesecore.certificates.ca

Interface CaSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    CaSessionLocal, CaSessionRemote
    public interface CaSession
    CRUD bean for creating, removing and retrieving CAs.
    Version:
    $Id: CaSession.java 29306 2018-06-21 14:07:02Z andresjakobs $

    • Method Detail

      • addCA

        void addCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
           org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CA ca)
    throws CAExistsException,
           org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Adds a CA to the database
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        ca - the CA to add
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - if CA already exists
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to add CA

      • editCA

        void editCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
            org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo cainfo)
     throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
            org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Changes a CA in the database. Can change mostly everything except caid, caname and subject DN. When editing a CA the CA token will usually be taken off line. So you need to activate the CA token after editing, if auto-activation of the CA token is not enabled. There's also CAAdminSession.editCA() which handles some special cases, e.g. changing the Subject DN of uninitialized CAs.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        cainfo - the CAInfo to change values of the CA
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - If CA not found
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - If access denied

      • getAllCaIds

        List<Integer> getAllCaIds()
        Method returning id's of all CA's in system.
        Returns:
        a List (Integer) of CA id's

      • getAuthorizedCaIds

        List<Integer> getAuthorizedCaIds​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
        Method returning id's of all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns IDs of CAs.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<Integer> of available CA IDs

      • getAuthorizedCaNames

        Collection<String> getAuthorizedCaNames​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
        Method returning names of all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns names of CAs.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a Collection<String> of available CA names

      • getAuthorizedCaNamesToIds

        TreeMap<String,​Integer> getAuthorizedCaNamesToIds​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
        Like getAuthorizedCaNames(AuthenticationToken), but returns a TreeMap which includes the CA Id as well.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a Collection<String> of available CA names
        See Also:
        getAuthorizedCaNames(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken)

      • getAuthorizedCaInfos

        List<org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo> getAuthorizedCaInfos​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Method returning info objects for all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to. Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns CAInfo of CAs.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<CAInfo> of authorized CAs

      • getAuthorizedAndEnabledCaInfos

        List<org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo> getAuthorizedAndEnabledCaInfos​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Method returning info objects for all active CA's available to the system, i.e. not having status "external", uninitialized or "waiting for certificate response" and that the administrator is authorized to, Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns CAInfo of CAs.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<CAInfo> of authorized and enabled CAs

      • getAuthorizedAndNonExternalCaInfos

        List<org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo> getAuthorizedAndNonExternalCaInfos​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken)
        Method returning info objects for all non-external CA's available to the system, i.e. not having status "external", and that the administrator is authorized to. Does not log access control to all CAs it checks, because this does not give access to the CAs but only returns CAInfo of CAs.
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<CAInfo> of authorized and non-external CAs

      • getActiveCANames

        List<String> getActiveCANames​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin)
        Method returning names of all CA's available to the system that the administrator is authorized to i.e. not having status "external" or "waiting for certificate response"
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        Returns:
        a List<String> of available CA names

      • getCAInfo

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo getCAInfo​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                              String name)
                                       throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Returns a value object containing non-sensitive information about a CA give it's name.
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator calling the method
        name - human readable name of CA
        Returns:
        CAInfo value object, null if it doesn't exist
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin not authorized to CA

      • getCAInfo

        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CAInfo getCAInfo​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
                                              int caid)
                                       throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Returns a value object containing non-sensitive information about a CA give it's name.
        Parameters:
        admin - administrator calling the method
        caid - numerical unique id of CA
        Returns:
        CAInfo value object, null if it doesn't exist
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if admin not authorized to CA

      • getCaChain

        Collection<org.cesecore.certificates.certificate.CertificateWrapper> getCaChain​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken authenticationToken,
                                                                                String caName)
                                                                         throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException,
                                                                                org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException
        Fetches the current certificate chain for a CA. 
         Authorization requirements:
 - /administrator
 - /ca/<ca in question>
        Parameters:
        authenticationToken - administrator calling the method
        caName - the unique name of the CA whose certificate chain should be returned.
        Returns:
        a list of X509 Certificates or CVC Certificates with the root certificate last, or an empty list if the CA's status is "Waiting for certificate response".
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if the client does not fulfill the authorization requirements specified above.
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA with the CA name given as input does not exist.

      • removeCA

        void removeCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
              int caid)
       throws org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Method used to remove a CA from the system. You should first check that the CA isn't used by any EndEntity, Profile or AccessRule before it is removed. CADataHandler for example makes this check. Should be used with care. If any certificate has been created with the CA use revokeCA instead and don't remove it.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        caid - numerical unique id of CA If the CA does not exist, nothing happens the method return silently.
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to remove CA

      • renameCA

        void renameCA​(org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken admin,
              String oldname,
              String newname)
       throws CAExistsException,
              org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException,
              org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException
        Renames the short name of CA (used in administrators interfaces). This name does not have to be the same as SubjectDN and is only used for reference.
        Parameters:
        admin - AuthenticationToken of admin
        oldname - the name of the CA to rename
        newname - the new name of the CA
        Throws:
        CAExistsException - if the CA with newname already exists
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - if the CA with oldname does not exist
        org.cesecore.authorization.AuthorizationDeniedException - if not authorized to rename CA

      • existsCa

        boolean existsCa​(int caId)
        Check if a CA with given ID exists
        Parameters:
        caId - the CA ID
        Returns:
        true if a CA with the given ID exists

      • existsCa

        boolean existsCa​(String name)
        Check if a CA with given name exists
        Parameters:
        name - the CA name
        Returns:
        true if a CA with the given name exists

      • getFutureRolloverCertificate

        Certificate getFutureRolloverCertificate​(int caid)
                                  throws org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException
        Returns the future key/certificate rollover if a rollover is pending, or otherwise null.
        Parameters:
        caid - numerical unique id of CA
        Returns:
        Certificate
        Throws:
        org.cesecore.certificates.ca.CADoesntExistsException - If no CA with the given CA Id exists.
